title: The line graph compares the percentage of people in three countries who used the Internet between 1999 and 2009.
segments: people in three countries who used the Internet
highlight: people in three countries who used the Internet
description:
ðə laɪn ɡræf kəmˈpɛrz ðə pərˈsɛntəʤ ʌv ˈpipəl ɪn θri ˈkʌntriz hu juzd ði ˈɪntərˌnɛt bɪˈtwin 1999 ænd 2009.
→This sentence introduces the task by stating what the line graph shows.

title: It is clear that the proportion of the population who used the Internet increased in each country over the period shown.
description:
ɪt ɪz klɪr ðæt ðə prəˈpɔrʃən ʌv ðə ˌpɑpjəˈleɪʃən hu juzd ði ˈɪntərˌnɛt ɪnˈkrist ɪn iʧ ˈkʌntri ˈoʊvər ðə ˈpɪriəd ʃoʊn.
→This sentence presents a general trend observed from the graph.

title: Overall, a much larger percentage of Canadians and Americans had access to the Internet in comparison with Mexicans, and Canada experienced the fastest growth in Internet usage.
description:
ˈoʊvəˌrɔl, ə mʌʧ ˈlɑrʤər pərˈsɛntəʤ ʌv kəˈneɪdiənz ænd əˈmɛrəkənz hæd ˈækˌsɛs tu ði ˈɪntərˌnɛt ɪn kəmˈpɛrəsən wɪð ˈmɛksɪkənz, ænd ˈkænədə ɪkˈspɪriənst ðə ˈfæstəst ɡroʊθ ɪn ˈɪntərˌnɛt ˈjusəʤ.
→ This sentence summarizes two key points.

title: In 1999, the proportion of people using the Internet in the USA was about 20%.
description:
ɪn 1999, ðə prəˈpɔrʃən ʌv ˈpipəl ˈjuzɪŋ ði ˈɪntərˌnɛt ɪn ðə ˈjuˈɛˈseɪ wʌz əˈbaʊt 20%.
→This part describes the initial Internet usage rates in 1999.

title: The figures for Canada and Mexico were lower, at about 10% and 5% respectively.
description: ðə ˈfɪɡjərz fɔr ˈkænədə ænd ˈmɛksəˌkoʊ wɜr ˈloʊər, æt əˈbaʊt 10% ænd 5% rɪˈspɛktɪvli.

title: In 2005, Internet usage in both the USA and Canada rose to around 70% of the population, while the figure for Mexico reached just over 25%.
segments: in both the USA and Canada
description:
ɪn 2005, ˈɪntərˌnɛt ˈjusəʤ ɪn boʊθ ðə ˈjuˈɛˈseɪ ænd ˈkænədə roʊz tu əˈraʊnd 70% ʌv ðə ˌpɑpjəˈleɪʃən, waɪl ðə ˈfɪɡjər fɔr ˈmɛksəˌkoʊ riʧt ʤʌst ˈoʊvər 25%.
→This sentence highlights significant growth by 2005.

title: By 2009, the percentage of Internet users was highest in Canada.
description:
baɪ 2009, ðə pərˈsɛntəʤ ʌv ˈɪntərˌnɛt ˈjuzərz wʌz ˈhaɪəst ɪn ˈkænədə.
→Canada in the end of the period (2009)

title: Almost 100% of Canadians used the Internet, compared to about 80% of Americans and only 40% of Mexicans.
description:
ˈɔlˌmoʊst 100% ʌv kəˈneɪdiənz juzd ði ˈɪntərˌnɛt, kəmˈpɛrd tu əˈbaʊt 80% ʌv əˈmɛrəkənz ænd ˈoʊnli 40% ʌv ˈmɛksɪkənz.
→ The final comparison is made for 2009.

title: There have been immense advances in technology in most aspects of people's lives, especially in the field of education.
segments: in most aspects of people's lives, especially in the field of education.
description:
ðɛr hæv bɪn ɪˈmɛns ədˈvænsəz ɪn tɛkˈnɑləʤi ɪn moʊst ˈæˌspɛkts ʌv ˈpipəlz lɪvz, əˈspɛʃli ɪn ðə fild ʌv ˌɛʤəˈkeɪʃən.
There have been...in...,especially in...

title: Nowadays, an increasing number of students rely on computers to research for information and to produce a perfect paper for school purposes.
description: ˈnaʊəˌdeɪz, ən ɪnˈkrisɪŋ ˈnʌmbər ʌv ˈstudənts rɪˈlaɪ ɑn kəmˈpjutərz tu riˈsɜrʧ fɔr ˌɪnfərˈmeɪʃən ænd tu prəˈdus ə ˈpɜrˌfɪkt ˈpeɪpər fɔr skul ˈpɜrpəsəz.

title: Others have decided to leave the original way of learning to get knowledge through online schools.
segments: to leave the original way of learning
description: ˈʌðərz hæv ˌdɪˈsaɪdɪd tu liv ði əˈrɪʤənəl weɪ ʌv ˈlɜrnɪŋ tu ɡɛt ˈnɑləʤ θru ˈɔnˌlaɪn skulz.

title: These changes in the learning process have brought a special concern regarding the possible decrease of importance of teachers in the classroom.
segments: These changes in the learning process
highlight: These changes in the learning process
description:
ðiz ˈʧeɪnʤəz ɪn ðə ˈlɜrnɪŋ ˈprɑˌsɛs hæv brɔt ə ˈspɛʃəl kənˈsɜrn rəˈɡɑrdɪŋ ðə ˈpɑsəbəl ˈdiˌkris ʌv ɪmˈpɔrtəns ʌv ˈtiʧərz ɪn ðə ˈklæsˌrum.
Subject + Verb + Direct Object + Prepositional Phrase (regarding + Noun Phrase)

title: Some people believe the role of teachers started to fade because computers have been helping some students to progress in their studies quicker than when compared with an original classroom.
segments: computers have been helping some students
description:
sʌm ˈpipəl bɪˈliv ðə roʊl ʌv ˈtiʧərz ˈstɑrtɪd tu feɪd bɪˈkɔz kəmˈpjutərz hæv bɪn ˈhɛlpɪŋ sʌm ˈstudənts tu prəˈɡrɛs ɪn ðɛr ˈstʌdiz ˈkwɪkər ðæn wɛn kəmˈpɛrd wɪð ən əˈrɪʤənəl ˈklæsˌrum.
S + V + that + S + V + (because + S + V)

title: For example, in the same classroom, students have different intellectual capacities, thus some would be tied to a slow advance in their studies because of other's incapacity of understanding.
segments: a slow advance in their studies
highlight: a slow advance in their studies
description:
fɔr ɪɡˈzæmpəl, ɪn ðə seɪm ˈklæsˌrum, ˈstudənts hæv ˈdɪfərənt ˌɪntəˈlɛkʧuəl kəˈpæsətiz, ðʌs sʌm wʊd bi taɪd tu ə sloʊ ədˈvæns ɪn ðɛr ˈstʌdiz bɪˈkɔz ʌv ˈʌðərz ɪnkəˈpæsəti ʌv ˌʌndərˈstændɪŋ.
(Linking phrase-For example,) + (Prepositional Phrase) + S + V + (Linking adverb-thus + S + V) + (Prepositional Phrase of Reason)

title: In this way, pupils could progress in their acquisition of knowledge at their own pace using computers instead of learning from teachers.
segments: using computers instead of learning from teachers.
description: ɪn ðɪs weɪ, ˈpjupəlz kʊd ˈprɑˌɡrɛs ɪn ðɛr ˌækwəˈzɪʃən ʌv ˈnɑləʤ æt ðɛr oʊn peɪs ˈjuzɪŋ kəmˈpjutərz ɪnˈstɛd ʌv ˈlɜrnɪŋ frʌm ˈtiʧərz.

title: However, the presence of a teacher is essential for students because the human contact influences them in positive ways.
description: ˌhaʊˈɛvər, ðə ˈprɛzəns ʌv ə ˈtiʧər ɪz ɪˈsɛnʃəl fɔr ˈstudənts bɪˈkɔz ðə ˈhjumən ˈkɑnˌtækt ˈɪnˌfluənsɪz ðɛm ɪn ˈpɑzətɪv weɪz.

title: Firstly, students realize that they are not dealing with a machine but with a human being who deserves attention and respect.
description:
ˈfɜrstli, ˈstudənts ˈriəˌlaɪz ðæt ðeɪ ɑr nɑt ˈdilɪŋ wɪð ə məˈʃin bʌt wɪð ə ˈhjumən ˈbiɪŋ hu dɪˈzɜrvz əˈtɛnʃən ænd rɪˈspɛkt.
(Linking adverb) + S + V + that + S + V + (but with + Noun) + (who + V + Object)

title: They also learn the importance of studying in group and respect other students, which helps them to improve their social skills.
description:
ðeɪ ˈɔlsoʊ lɜrn ði ɪmˈpɔrtəns ʌv ˈstʌdiɪŋ ɪn ɡrup ænd rɪˈspɛkt ˈʌðər ˈstudənts, wɪʧ hɛlps ðɛm tu ɪmˈpruv ðɛr ˈsoʊʃəl skɪlz.
S + V + (Complex Noun Phrase) + which + V + Object

title: Moreover, teachers are required in the learning process because they acknowledge some student's deficiencies and help them to solve their problems by repeating the same explanation, giving extra exercises or even suggesting a private tutor.
description:
mɔˈroʊvər, ˈtiʧərz ɑr riˈkwaɪərd ɪn ðə ˈlɜrnɪŋ ˈprɑˌsɛs bɪˈkɔz ðeɪ ækˈnɑlɪʤ sʌm ˈstudənts dɪˈfɪʃənsiz ænd hɛlp ðɛm tu sɑlv ðɛr ˈprɑbləmz baɪ rɪˈpitɪŋ ðə seɪm ˌɛkspləˈneɪʃən, ˈɡɪvɪŋ ˈɛkstrə ˈɛksərˌsaɪzəz ɔr ˈivɪn səɡˈʤɛstɪŋ ə ˈpraɪvət ˈtutər.
(Linking adverb-Moreover,) + S + be + V (Passive voice) + (because + S + V + and + V) + (by + V-ing, V-ing, or even V-ing)

title: Hence, students can have a bigger chance not to fail in a subject.
segments: students can have a bigger chance
description:
hɛns, ˈstudənts kæn hæv ə ˈbɪɡər ʧæns nɑt tu feɪl ɪn ə ˈsʌbʤɪkt.
(Linking adverb-Hence,) + S + Modal Verb + V + (Infinitive Phrase-not to fail in...)

title: In conclusion, the role for teachers in the learning process is still very important and it will continue to be in the future because no machine can replace the human interaction and its consequences.
segments: the role for teachers in the learning process
and it will continue to be in the future
the human interaction and its consequences
highlight: the role for teachers in the learning process
and it will continue to be in the future
the human interaction and its consequences
description:
ɪn kənˈkluʒən, ðə roʊl fɔr ˈtiʧərz ɪn ðə ˈlɜrnɪŋ ˈprɑˌsɛs ɪz stɪl ˈvɛri ɪmˈpɔrtənt ænd ɪt wɪl kənˈtɪnju tu bi ɪn ðə ˈfjuʧər bɪˈkɔz noʊ məˈʃin kæn ˌriˈpleɪs ðə ˈhjumən ˌɪntəˈrækʃən ænd ɪts ˈkɑnsəˌkwɛnsəz.
(Introductory Phrase-In conclusion,) + S + V + (and + S + V) + (because + S + V)
